product_info.name: RORSOU R10 On-Ear Headphones with Microphone, Lightweight Folding Stereo Bass Headphones with 1.5M No-Tangle Cord, Portable Wired Headphones for Smartphone Tablet Computer MP3 / 4 (Black)

reviews.review_text: I bought these headphones twice because I love how they fit my head and how they sound! They're super comfortable to use. I tend to use them a lot to listen to music, watch livestreams or tune in to work meetings. Due to the nature of the extendable plastic top part, it does tend to crack at the sides. So, be careful of how you store your headphones. HOWEVER, I use these headphones nearly daily and find myself needing a replacement about a year later due to wear and tear. I keep coming back since these headphones have quickly become my favorite and reliable brand/pair to use!
Feels like nice quality, color looks great. Comfortable to wear, sound quality is good. Not too heavy for kids.

My boys (9 and 6) are animals.  They use these daily.  Have lasted over a year, still in great condition. Also purchased the Earfun headphones, similar style.  My kids prefer the Rorsou ones b/c the sound is better and they are more comfortable.  The Earfun ones are newer, but the ear covering is starting to peel and there is a slight cracking starting to happen on the plastic that goes around the top of the head.  My kids are ROUGH on their toys.  This is a quality product and am purchasing again to replace the Earfun ones because they're on their way out.

reviews.review_header: Good sound at an attractive price
reviews.review_text: I often use these when practicing on my Yamaha clp-745 digital piano.  Sound through the headphones is actually better than through the piano's speakers (which is typical with headphones....I'm told).  Makes playing the piano sound like an acoustic 9' grand piano. It does lack some in the upper two octaves but delivers very good bass sound. Mid-range notes sound good but are not as crisp as you might want but still sound amazing. And the most amazing thing is I have purchased 4 or5 five other headphones off Amazon which were priced at twice what this one cost.  I had to send most of them back because they were so bad. I used to always refer to Amazon reviews when selecting an item, but lately I am thinking they may be made up. So...main thought is that these inexpensive headphones sound great for what they cost and I recommend you give them a try. I am an adult and they fit and feel good on my head.

Bought these for an international trip.  I didn't want to worry about if they got stolen or not.  Worked great on the plane to cancel out noise.  Very comfortable.  Had them for a long time now and they are still going strong.  Then, to my surprise they have a microphone and I can use them on conference calls!  These just keep on giving.

I bought these for my son mostly because they were his favorite color combo, and because he needed them for his 2nd grade class and didn't want to spend a lot of money on something that'll probably go missing before the middle of the year. We're so impressed with the quality, I'm ordering a second pair! They fit him great with room to grow, they're a great value, and they work well for him.
Very comfortable, light and good quality sound for my MP3 player.  Also stylish

reviews.review_header: Great Sound, Unfortunately Not Very Sturdy
reviews.review_text: So the individual features they ask you to rate all apply to sound, as as far as sound goes these are great for the price.  However, the part that locks the headphones in place when you move them from folded to ready to wear broke early on in the life of my pair.  This wasn't super bothersome, as you only really keep them unfolded if you're going to wear them, and they aren't spring loaded or anything crazy to where they try and close while you're wearing them.  Folding and unfolding is strictly a manual event, and as a 45 year old man I know the value of NOT trying to do something odd like hold one earpiece and fling them open.  I always GENTLY opened them and put them on.  The other week, as I removed them, I *did* hold them by one side and reached out to put them down.  The unit broke where the hard plastic meets the soft bit that cushions your head.  They don't fold there naturally.  I've NEVER flung them down in anger or otherwise done anything other than take them off and set them down in a calm fashion.TL;DR - Good sound, super fragile.  Treat them like they're made of glass.

reviews.review_header: didn't last as long as i would've hoped...
reviews.review_text: Aside from the discomfort from the initial tightness which goes away after a few weeks of use, and the okay sound quality (the only issue i had with that was that it was a bit *too* stereo), the head band managed to snap within eight months of using it. I don't think these are very good for flexibility.Another thing that really bugged me was that the little piece on each joint, which is apparently supposed to keep the internal wire in place, pops out within the month. I've bought this twice and it's happened both times. (the sticky stuff in the picture came from when i took the tape off because i had tried to tape it down early on, remembering that it happened the first time, and it still didn't work.)
My child complains that the headphones are too tight and hurt her ears. I will be returning, unfortunately.
I can't get them to work right. Buttons don't do what they are to do.
Our son uses these for school and they work ok.
The headphones themselves are great but the cord broke after only 1 month of school. Unfortunately the return window is closed, but I will buy a different brand now that my son needs a new pair.

These headphones are great for the price, especially their sound quality. Unfortunately, the midsection will break, or one of the hinges will fail very easily. I have bought multiple pairs before realizing that they are far too delicate to travel with me for school.Would only recommend if you need to save money and plan to keep them at a stationary device such as a desktop.

I have never written an Amazon review before but these headphones are just something else.  Since I was in high school I have bought, these 2 headphones because the quality of these headphones are something else.Incredibly comfortable, I have a small head so I always have to just headphones to fir my head, and children's headphones are a bit tight and usually cheaper quality. These headphones fit just right.They also cover my entire ear completely, making noise harder to get into my ear. Even if I am not listening to anything I like having them on because they stop noises from entering my ear.Because the sound quality is so good and very loud, I don't have to put my headphones on full when in a noisy room. If you are a student and get easily distracted by noises, parents, family, etc. these headphones will help you concentrate.I attribute my good math grades in college to these headphones because I could listen to music during tests and not hear other people's noises. (clearing throats, shuffling, etc,) helping me focus on my math tests a lot easier.To wrap things up, its amazing for students, to block noise, very comfortable on head and ears, easy to use,  only downside was the first time I got these headphones the mic did not work; but the second time buying them they did. I recommend to students, teachers, travelers, children, adults, office workers, etc.
Used the headset for a online gathering. Worked perfectly.

reviews.review_header: You get what you pay for!
reviews.review_text: Another lesson learned, when it comes to electronics you get what you pay for. The RORSOU R10 headphones are compact, but that is where the un-asterisked positives end. My pair arrived half broken; the right side non-functional out of the box with no obvious fix. The sound out of the left side is of moderate quality, so I imagine that a functional pair would sound about the same. The headphones feel sturdy and are fairly comfortable for short-term wear, but the padding material on the headband will pull at your hair. They don't look professional either, so they are best for casual use, maybe with a hat or hood between your head and the headband... Final verdict: If you can afford these headphones, you can probably afford to swing for a $50 pair and spare yourself some headache (literally.) If you're on a tight budget, you would be better served with a cheaper, plain black pair -- it will still get the job done -- and you won't feel so bad if they're half-broken on arrival!

Average sound quality, it is somewhat flimsy and breaks too easily though, First broke within around 2 months but was still usable and totally broke within 7 months, also feels unnecessarily bulky, there are better headphones for the price but it's not the worst.
I’ve only had these for 2 months and don’t use them often. They are already going in and out. I guess you get what you pay for

They are really comfortable, which makes their inevitable destruction all the more devastating. I looked through the reviews and decided to take my chances after having bought my previous favorite headphones from the same brand. In a tragic turn of events, the second time using them my ear was attacked by a loud static hissing sound in the left ear, which was the ear the audio was unevenly louder in. I unplugged them, waited a few seconds, and plugged them back in, and it seemed to go away. However, in only a few minutes it was back and I gave up. The only reason you should buy these is if you’re one of those people who like to stand around wearing headphones so people won’t talk to you, because they are extremely comfortable (though the color combinations available are in a word, interesting). Otherwise, look elsewhere.

reviews.review_header: Lightweight and Great Sound Quality for the Price!
reviews.review_text: The RORSOU R10 On-Ear Headphones have been a pleasant surprise, delivering a good mix of sound quality, comfort, and portability at an affordable price. I’ve used these daily for both work and leisure, and here’s my detailed take:Key Features I Loved:Sound Quality: The stereo bass is surprisingly rich and clear for a budget pair of headphones. It handles music, podcasts, and even phone calls well without distortion.Lightweight Design: The headphones are incredibly light, making them comfortable to wear for long periods without causing ear fatigue.Portable and Foldable: The folding design is a big plus for anyone on the go. It fits easily in my bag without taking up much space.No-Tangle Cord: The 1.5M cord is a perfect length and, as promised, it doesn’t tangle easily, which makes it hassle-free to use.Room for Improvement:Build Quality: While the headphones look sleek, the plastic construction feels a bit fragile. I’d be cautious about dropping or rough handling.Microphone Placement: The microphone works fine, but its placement on the cord sometimes picks up unwanted rubbing noises during calls.Personal Insights:I use these headphones primarily for video calls and casual listening. They’ve performed consistently well and are especially good for quick tasks like plugging into a smartphone or tablet. The bass isn’t as deep as high-end models, but it’s more than adequate for this price point.Why I Recommend It:For under $20, these headphones provide excellent value. They’re perfect for students, commuters, or anyone looking for an affordable, no-frills audio solution. If you treat them gently, they’re a solid, budget-friendly choice.Summary:The RORSOU R10 On-Ear Headphones are a great option for everyday use, offering good sound quality, comfort, and portability. While the build could be sturdier, their performance and features make them a worthwhile buy for anyone on a budget!
The headphones fit comfortably. The cord is long enough to allow movement but not so long that it tangles.

I honestly was not expecting how great he sound quality was until I actually put them on. Not only did it block out any other sounds around me but the sound quality all around was clear and crisp. And the best part..the price. Talk about a win, win.  Very happy.

Amazing sound quality.  They are lightweight yet pretty sturdy as long as you don't get crazy with them! I wear them to bed at night so I can listen to scripture or meditation music. They are very comfy and have adequate cord length.  I would purchase again.

reviews.review_header: Lightweight and Great Sound Quality for the Price!
reviews.review_text: The RORSOU R10 On-Ear Headphones have been a pleasant surprise, delivering a good mix of sound quality, comfort, and portability at an affordable price. I’ve used these daily for both work and leisure, and here’s my detailed take:Key Features I Loved:Sound Quality: The stereo bass is surprisingly rich and clear for a budget pair of headphones. It handles music, podcasts, and even phone calls well without distortion.Lightweight Design: The headphones are incredibly light, making them comfortable to wear for long periods without causing ear fatigue.Portable and Foldable: The folding design is a big plus for anyone on the go. It fits easily in my bag without taking up much space.No-Tangle Cord: The 1.5M cord is a perfect length and, as promised, it doesn’t tangle easily, which makes it hassle-free to use.Room for Improvement:Build Quality: While the headphones look sleek, the plastic construction feels a bit fragile. I’d be cautious about dropping or rough handling.Microphone Placement: The microphone works fine, but its placement on the cord sometimes picks up unwanted rubbing noises during calls.Personal Insights:I use these headphones primarily for video calls and casual listening. They’ve performed consistently well and are especially good for quick tasks like plugging into a smartphone or tablet. The bass isn’t as deep as high-end models, but it’s more than adequate for this price point.Why I Recommend It:For under $20, these headphones provide excellent value. They’re perfect for students, commuters, or anyone looking for an affordable, no-frills audio solution. If you treat them gently, they’re a solid, budget-friendly choice.Summary:The RORSOU R10 On-Ear Headphones are a great option for everyday use, offering good sound quality, comfort, and portability. While the build could be sturdier, their performance and features make them a worthwhile buy for anyone on a budget!
The headphones fit comfortably. The cord is long enough to allow movement but not so long that it tangles.

reviews.review_header: You get what you pay for!
reviews.review_text: Another lesson learned, when it comes to electronics you get what you pay for. The RORSOU R10 headphones are compact, but that is where the un-asterisked positives end. My pair arrived half broken; the right side non-functional out of the box with no obvious fix. The sound out of the left side is of moderate quality, so I imagine that a functional pair would sound about the same. The headphones feel sturdy and are fairly comfortable for short-term wear, but the padding material on the headband will pull at your hair. They don't look professional either, so they are best for casual use, maybe with a hat or hood between your head and the headband... Final verdict: If you can afford these headphones, you can probably afford to swing for a $50 pair and spare yourself some headache (literally.) If you're on a tight budget, you would be better served with a cheaper, plain black pair -- it will still get the job done -- and you won't feel so bad if they're half-broken on arrival!

reviews.review_header: Good sound at an attractive price
reviews.review_text: I often use these when practicing on my Yamaha clp-745 digital piano.  Sound through the headphones is actually better than through the piano's speakers (which is typical with headphones....I'm told).  Makes playing the piano sound like an acoustic 9' grand piano. It does lack some in the upper two octaves but delivers very good bass sound. Mid-range notes sound good but are not as crisp as you might want but still sound amazing. And the most amazing thing is I have purchased 4 or5 five other headphones off Amazon which were priced at twice what this one cost.  I had to send most of them back because they were so bad. I used to always refer to Amazon reviews when selecting an item, but lately I am thinking they may be made up. So...main thought is that these inexpensive headphones sound great for what they cost and I recommend you give them a try. I am an adult and they fit and feel good on my head.

There is also audio leakage so if someone is next to you and you're blasting music they'll probably hear lol but that's not that a big of a deal to me, I'd rather have good sound quality than care if my sound is slightly leaking.Overall review:Solid headphones especially for the price, will definitely buy again for the sound quality alone!

reviews.review_header: Good headphones but breaks very fast

I've had these for 15 months.They've been great until today when all the sudden people on my calls say that I'm breaking up.The joints of the headphones have both broken.  One several months ago, and one this week.  So I'm wondering if that second break is the cause of the mic issues.Pros:-good sound quality-blocks out a good amount of surrounding noise for me (via some good cushiony headphones)-blocks out a good amount of surrounding noise for those listening to me on calls (via some kind of noise control in the mic)-comfortable, no more headachesCons:-relatively short shelf life
These did not hold up for my son.

I run a woodshop and hearing protection is important. Routers, saws, planers all make an incredible amount of noise and these do not block out as much of the sound as I would like. The sound and the Bluetooth work well. These will work well for listening to your computer or tv, just not well suited for the workshop.

The sound is OK, but not great, rather flat.The worst part is they are too small.  It hurt to wear them more for a few minutes.I gave them to my grandson.You are better off spending more on a higher quality set.

reviews.review_header: The mic is very low quality. If you need this meetings DO NOT BUY. Otherwise, good sound.
reviews.review_text: I bought this to replace my other headphones for meetings. But given how quickly those died, I wanted something cheaper. I saw these and loved the color and the reviews seemed to rate it highly so I went for them. When I first used them for a meeting no one could hear me. Granted I should have sound checked first. For even remotely good sound, you have to put the mic that's lockated on the control with the volume switch close to your mouth. Even than it sounds muffled and even if it was fine...other headphones at this price point of clear sound and my hands can remain free.The sound is fantastic especially for the price. But if you need the mic...I would walk away from this headset.

I bought these headphones to use with my computer. They are high quality, and I would otherwise give them 4-5 stars, but my goodness, the button on the cord makes these headphones annoying. Any accidental pinch or jerk of the cord, and it will pause YouTube videos, or play a YouTube video in the background that I paused earlier, sometimes it activates Siri or opens up Apple Music.

reviews.review_header: Decent for price, but not high-quality
reviews.review_text: I have purchased these twice, one for each son. The first ones lasted about 10 months before giving out on vocal audio- the music still plays, but you can't hear vocals.  The second pair only lasted 5 months before cracking. I suppose for the cost it should be expected, but it's a bummer to have to throw away a big piece of equipment that only doesn't work bc of poor production. Alas.

reviews.review_header: Equates the quality to its price.
reviews.review_text: It's not bad for $20.00 but if this product was more, I would not be happy with them. The initial physical quality is actually pretty good. They feel and look very sturdy. The sound quality is what suffers. It's far better than a set of skull candy earbuds; however, the sound is like that of listening to music with a can or a plastic cup on your ear. I get used to it halfway through a song, but it's not a timbre I admire in a pair of headphones. Noise cancelation is a lie. These do not have any such technology. The only escape from ambient noise comes from the padding. It's noise muffling, not noise canceling. With that said, the padding doesn't do too bad of a job. I at first thought I was listening with noise canceling tech. For music, I would not recommend these. For simple gaming or in any other application where the sound quality is not a priority or you just want a cheap set of head phones without going with buds, I'd say save money and buy these.

reviews.review_header: Ear Hurts after wearing for like 20 mins
reviews.review_text: When I wore them for the first day I thought my ear was just adjusting to the headphones, but I've used it for 20 days now and the pain persists, though these are decent for the price, that's about it, nothing great about them, probably goto an electronics store try getting good headphones that are comfortable for your ear.Going to return these after 20 days of use.

I just received them and they feel good on the ears, but my phone says not compatible......Pixel 4a(5g)? I have the extender short cord, that connects the HP to the phone port and nothing? These would be good if you don't need to use your headphones daily.  Not for heavy use.

reviews.review_header: Not as comfortable as you might think
reviews.review_text: This is a case of you get what you pay for. I was on a very limited budget and trying to get a headset so I could listen to music at work as well as use for virtual meetings, as my previous headset was falling apart.Looking at reviews on this item I saw multiple people saying it was more comfortable than expected and I think they might have been referring to kids.I am a 27-year old man and these are not very comfortable. The fake leather isn't very soft and your ears will start to hurt after an hour of wearing these. I work 8 hours a day so that's pretty frustrating. I am considering returning these and looking for something else that I can wear for longer than that.

reviews.review_header: Very uncomfortable and no volume control, but decent sound quality.
reviews.review_text: These are competitively priced and for the price, the sound quality is decent.  The bass is a bit weak, but the midrange and treble are crisp and clear.  The main problem is that these are very tight on the ear and cannot be worn for more than 45 minutes without causing pain.  These work better for kids because they are not as tight on children under 10 Y, and we got these for our grandson.  He is OK with them, although they do bother him if he wears them more than an hour.
My son liked these, but they lasted only three months before they broke. It broke in the section near where they fold.

These headphones look great, are a good fit and they are really comfortable but the sound quality on them isn’t that good it sounds very bad and I don’t like it at all, and there is no volume control on it which I don’t like because i have to lower my volume from time to time but I can’t because it doesn’t have a volume control, so if you are looking for good sound quality headphones with a volume control I recommend you to look somewhere else and not buy these.

reviews.review_header: Broke after less than a year of use

reviews.review_header: After about 2 months: I could hear crystal clear, but others couldn't hear me.
reviews.review_text: I loved these until they stopped working. I could still hear through them, but they no longer picked up sound. It was frustrating as they went in and out like they had a short. People could hear me, but then they couldn't and then they could - all on the same meeting and there wasn't a set way to move the cord to make it work.Gave them to my daughter and she still uses them to listen to audio books, but they don't work for communication. Only worked to pick up sound a couple to maybe 3 months.

reviews.review_header: They're comfortable, but only one side works
reviews.review_text: I bought these to replace a pair of headphones that were around 8 years old, still working perfectly, but sadly disintegrating. I bought these because they looked comfortable. They are. But, about a week after I got them the sound went out on the right side. I'm still using them because the sound on the left side is pretty good, but I wear them with the left side on my right ear because my hearing is better on that side. I didn't return them because I am lazy. The end, an awful story about mediocre headphones, by me.

reviews.review_header: Good for a year then the wire breaks
reviews.review_text: These work for $14 headphones. they did what I needed them to do for a year then the wire connecting to the headphone breaks off. Its just a small cheap wire and when you take off the headphones they close together, so teh other sid from the wire rubs against the wire and breaks it off. So if you just want cheap headphones for a year, for $14 then these work. They sound is what you would expect for the price but not bad. They should reinforce the connection to the headset and it would last for much longer. Too bad, now Im having to buy another set. I wont buy these agian though because there is no way to keep it from breaking so I would end up here again in a year. lol

reviews.review_header: DOWNGRADED RATING: Cord gets tangled;  too short cord
reviews.review_text: This cord is poorly constructed.  It has good sound quality, but the earpieces are too small (and I'm petite), and the cord gets tangled up and is too short.  I have to turn the wire in the socket around to hear the sound consistently!

reviews.review_text: FOR THE PRICE, THEY ARE NOT BAD. My first review was based on my own mistakes because there was no use-manual or instructions. Simple, basic, comfortable. Decent bass, nice mid-ranges. No frills. Worth a try.
Quick delivery and average product.  You can save money with these headphones.  Good for kids,
I mean, they're not incapabale of reproducing sounds.  But in the name of God, please buy the  Sennheiser 280's instead.These are comfy, but wow are they poor at echo, responsiveness, etc.

These headphones look great, are a good fit and they are really comfortable but the sound quality on them isn’t that good it sounds very bad and I don’t like it at all, and there is no volume control on it which I don’t like because i have to lower my volume from time to time but I can’t because it doesn’t have a volume control, so if you are looking for good sound quality headphones with a volume control I recommend you to look somewhere else and not buy these.
Overall Good headset. It's pretty uncomfortable after a while it hurts your ears. the microphone is not the best.
it broke under 3-4 months
They are to tight and not comfortable.

reviews.review_header: Screw Fell Out No Longer Stay Together
reviews.review_text: They are awesome headphones but a simple screw on the inside of the headphone fell out and they no longer stay together. Only been used a few times.Disappointed for the price paid for them to only last a few month with minimal use.

Because the ear muff dissent cover my ears, the other noise around me is audible and none of the features are effective.  I think the entire headset is too small.  There was no info on size with the details on Amazon.  I've owned better.

reviews.review_header: Not as comfortable as you might think
reviews.review_text: This is a case of you get what you pay for. I was on a very limited budget and trying to get a headset so I could listen to music at work as well as use for virtual meetings, as my previous headset was falling apart.Looking at reviews on this item I saw multiple people saying it was more comfortable than expected and I think they might have been referring to kids.I am a 27-year old man and these are not very comfortable. The fake leather isn't very soft and your ears will start to hurt after an hour of wearing these. I work 8 hours a day so that's pretty frustrating. I am considering returning these and looking for something else that I can wear for longer than that.
Ex loves these. Took a while to ship and arrived after we broke up though

They look and feel nice but the sound is kind of subpar. Not terrible for the price but I think it's worth spending a bit more for better sound. They're not too terribly made but they do also feel like they won't last very long.

reviews.review_header: Great headset at first, but broke after a month of daily use
reviews.review_text: this is the third round of headphones I've had to buy for my kids.  The sound quality is great and the kids like being able to differentiate their headphones by color, but after around a month of daily use, the sound starts to crackle, and consistently stops working on one side. These would be good if you don't need to use your headphones daily.  Not for heavy use.
After a long time wearing, they actually hurt.

reviews.review_header: Super cute but a bit off on me
reviews.review_text: Great construction and sound. Super cute on top of that. Unfortunately these were a bit too tight and sat too low for me - they cause intense jaw pain and the noise cancelling triggered my migraines.If those aren't problems for you, then definitely get these!

reviews.review_header: Equates the quality to its price.
reviews.review_text: It's not bad for $20.00 but if this product was more, I would not be happy with them. The initial physical quality is actually pretty good. They feel and look very sturdy. The sound quality is what suffers. It's far better than a set of skull candy earbuds; however, the sound is like that of listening to music with a can or a plastic cup on your ear. I get used to it halfway through a song, but it's not a timbre I admire in a pair of headphones. Noise cancelation is a lie. These do not have any such technology. The only escape from ambient noise comes from the padding. It's noise muffling, not noise canceling. With that said, the padding doesn't do too bad of a job. I at first thought I was listening with noise canceling tech. For music, I would not recommend these. For simple gaming or in any other application where the sound quality is not a priority or you just want a cheap set of head phones without going with buds, I'd say save money and buy these.
headline says it all

reviews.review_header: No volume control on the headset.
reviews.review_text: Overall, these are adequate headphones. Good price. Decent quality for the price. But I'm disappointed that there is no volume control  and you can also hear creaking through the frame if the wire is jostled or tugged on.
Broke a few weeks into the school year for my 5th grader

These suit the purpose of letting you listen to tv or radio in private and sound decent but they are made of very cheap plastic and will break easily. Mine broke in 3 different places, once when it fell from couch cushion to carpeted floor. All I can think is the plastic is very low quality. So if you plan to use these daily don't expect them to last long. Mine lasted 1 year before being barely usable. They no longer stay on my head. You get what you pay for.

reviews.review_header: The mic is very low quality. If you need this meetings DO NOT BUY. Otherwise, good sound.
reviews.review_text: I bought this to replace my other headphones for meetings. But given how quickly those died, I wanted something cheaper. I saw these and loved the color and the reviews seemed to rate it highly so I went for them. When I first used them for a meeting no one could hear me. Granted I should have sound checked first. For even remotely good sound, you have to put the mic that's lockated on the control with the volume switch close to your mouth. Even than it sounds muffled and even if it was fine...other headphones at this price point of clear sound and my hands can remain free.The sound is fantastic especially for the price. But if you need the mic...I would walk away from this headset.
The sound is good lasted a few months before one side stopped randomly working
Love the sound,  but they made my ears sweaty and itchy.
good, but the cord is extremely short and i can barely walk 2 feet without it yanking my computer, it also keeps unplugging

I run a woodshop and hearing protection is important. Routers, saws, planers all make an incredible amount of noise and these do not block out as much of the sound as I would like. The sound and the Bluetooth work well. These will work well for listening to your computer or tv, just not well suited for the workshop.

reviews.review_header: Great Sound, Unfortunately Not Very Sturdy
reviews.review_text: So the individual features they ask you to rate all apply to sound, as as far as sound goes these are great for the price.  However, the part that locks the headphones in place when you move them from folded to ready to wear broke early on in the life of my pair.  This wasn't super bothersome, as you only really keep them unfolded if you're going to wear them, and they aren't spring loaded or anything crazy to where they try and close while you're wearing them.  Folding and unfolding is strictly a manual event, and as a 45 year old man I know the value of NOT trying to do something odd like hold one earpiece and fling them open.  I always GENTLY opened them and put them on.  The other week, as I removed them, I *did* hold them by one side and reached out to put them down.  The unit broke where the hard plastic meets the soft bit that cushions your head.  They don't fold there naturally.  I've NEVER flung them down in anger or otherwise done anything other than take them off and set them down in a calm fashion.TL;DR - Good sound, super fragile.  Treat them like they're made of glass.

I've had these for 15 months.They've been great until today when all the sudden people on my calls say that I'm breaking up.The joints of the headphones have both broken.  One several months ago, and one this week.  So I'm wondering if that second break is the cause of the mic issues.Pros:-good sound quality-blocks out a good amount of surrounding noise for me (via some good cushiony headphones)-blocks out a good amount of surrounding noise for those listening to me on calls (via some kind of noise control in the mic)-comfortable, no more headachesCons:-relatively short shelf life

The sound is OK, but not great, rather flat.The worst part is they are too small.  It hurt to wear them more for a few minutes.I gave them to my grandson.You are better off spending more on a higher quality set.
Good, but not for long term. Breaks every 6 to 8 months.
They make your head feel like it is in a vice. They are very tight!

Headphones Sound good, but They are too HEAVY for me, but I plan to keep them. I just can't Wear them very long at a Time because they are Heavy and I'm use to Light weight Headphones that I can wear all Day.

The headphones work ok, but after wearing them for longer periods of time (more than an hour) they become quite uncomfortable.  I’ve adjusted them to go as loose as possible, but they still pinch my ears.

I cannot recommend these. The sound quality of these headphones is okay for the price but these are EXTREMELY small. I am a 5'1" person weighing about 105 lb and these were like a vice on the head. I would recommend the headphones by Ailihen. Those headphones lasted about 3 years before needing replacement.

reviews.review_header: Was nice while it lasted but it only lasted 2 months
reviews.review_text: Our son used it constantly with his laptop for remote learning, it suddenly stopped working. The design is too fragile. We’ve switched to in-ear headphones instead.
They're very comfortable, and definitely help with muffling sound, but there's a deep booming noise in the background while I'm listening to anything. Sound quality isn't great.
FIT TOO TIGHT. HURT MY EARS. SHOULD BE ADJUSTABLE TO RELIEVE PRESSURE ON EARS. DISTRACTS FROM MOVIE ENJOYMENT.

The sound quality of these headphones is on par with the price. Can expect a reasonable delivery of music and spoken word. These are not the most comfortable headphones for sure. I personally can wear them for about 20 minutes until they start becoming uncomfortable. I've attempted to "stretch out" the headband and have taken it about as far as I can without fear of breakage. To sum it up, the old adage "you get what you pay for" certainly applies.

For $12.86 including tax, I don't think these headphones can be beat. The sound reproduction of music is obviously limited in range, but if you just want to hear some music on your laptop or desktop computer it's probably the best you can find for under about $50.
they work good but the comfort was not up there.

I bought these to compare to two other headphones I bought at the same time.  Of the three, this was my least favorite.  First, it weighed more than the other two.  Second, it didn't fit my head as comfortably as either of the other sets.  Sent them back to Amazon for a refund.

Has anyone else had this issue? I hate to send them back, but I have to. Thanks for any comments or suggestions!

these headphones are quite good but if you got a big head you should be careful I've had my pair for like 6 months and its starting to crack at the top of it because it can't really fit my head to well. but if you got small head these are great.

This is my second attempt to replace an excellent headphone that I broke and is no longer available on Amazon.  This item doesn't measure up. Not particularly enjoying the inconsistency of sound so I rarely use it which is unfortunate.

reviews.review_header: Very uncomfortable and no volume control, but decent sound quality.
reviews.review_text: These are competitively priced and for the price, the sound quality is decent.  The bass is a bit weak, but the midrange and treble are crisp and clear.  The main problem is that these are very tight on the ear and cannot be worn for more than 45 minutes without causing pain.  These work better for kids because they are not as tight on children under 10 Y, and we got these for our grandson.  He is OK with them, although they do bother him if he wears them more than an hour.

The price is definitely reasonable... I don't need a fancy pair of headphones so these will do. The last 2 pairs of headphones I had, had plastic bands and I wasn't doing anything rough with them, I was just opening them to put them on and the plastic broke. This one has a metal band which is a little tight, but I'm sure they'll loosen over time... and I think I'll have these for a few years to come.

reviews.review_header: Work well, could be more durable
reviews.review_text: I bought each of my kids a pair of these headphones to use with their movie players and iPads. They love how comfortable they are and the great colors. Unfortunately one of the posts that plug into the headphone port broke off inside the jack. I was able to remove it as there was a bit sticking out. I’d absolutely say user error EXCEPT the kid that it happened to is my careful kid. Anyway, the other two are holding up so far.

The reason I rate this 4 stars is because after a few months the right side stopped working, and I don’t think these headphones are supposed to break after a few months. Overall everything was great! I just wish I didn’t have to buy a new pair so soon.

These headphones are great for the price! They fit comfortably, provide excellent sound and noise cancellation. I wasn't able to get the built in microphone feature to work (maybe it's just me) so I gave it four stars instead of five.

reviews.review_header: These are really some great headphones for the price; but no privacy.
reviews.review_text: No.  They are not the anything and everything.  I kind of wish I spent some more to get some wireless earbuds.  But you are not going to go wrong with this headset.  It has great sound quality.  They do a great job sealing sound out, so you think all is quiet.  But the headset leaks a lot of noise.  I love listening to music, but I have found that I am being too loud.  These headphones kill all the outside noise and drop into a place of no distractions.  I love the sound quality of these headphones.  While you may think that you are in a quiet space alone with these headphones, you are going to have to think about those around you.  They are going to hear everything that you hear.  Be aware and be wise.  Sound quality is great, privacy quality sucks.  Everything that you hear, everyone around you hears the same.  No privacy if that is what you seek.

reviews.review_header: Extremely good value (sound and color choices) for the money
reviews.review_text: These headphones are great!  The sound quality is excellent, the microphone works well,  love the "fabric" wired cord and I'm happy that I can indulge my sense of whimsy with the color choices.  The only flaw for these headphones are the ear cushions aren't very comfortable. I wish they had just a tad more foam padding. Hence the four star rating rather than 5. Definitely recommend.

UPDATE: On 2/26/2024 these headphones broke on the actual headband area, right above the hinge where the ear covers can fold inward. I dont think is a defect, as these are meant for kids and I am obviously not one, but I aslo have been fairly rough with these and throwing them in my bag for a year to get jumbled around. Still love them, planning on just gluing it back since they still work.I needed new headset for work as my work-issued JABRAs are old and finally broke. I wanted the following things:-headset NOT earbuds (earbud never stay in)-wired so I dont have to worry about charging or taking up a valuable USB port-non-bluetooth so i dont have to worry about issues connecting-no installation software. I have a company issued laptop, so i can't install anything.- good enough sound. I'm using these for work so calls and listening to things on a laptop. don't need anything super noise cancelling, bass, surround sound or anything.I figured i'd take a chance but had low expectations as these were pretty cheap. I LOVE them. They are colorful which is just a bonus but these fit comfortable over my ears, which is great because I have small ears and often my ears feel smashed wearing headsets. The sound is great. The wire is fabric-threaded and not stiff, long enough so its easy to move around and not knock things over and im not worried about it fraying all over the place. All in all, a GREAT purchase for the price point.

reviews.review_header: Great product (with one minor exception) - needed wired headsets

I use the headsets daily, a few times a day for meetings (on and off my head).  They still function well but the flopping of the earpiece when putting on and taking off is annoying, so I have bought more to replace these.  For $21 each  I am not really upset.  I just thought this should be mentioned.  I took one star away due to this.  Functionally they should be a five star product for the low cost, even with replacing once or twice a year.

reviews.review_header: I love these but my mic doesn’t work?
reviews.review_text: I tried using these with discord so I could maybe start streaming but when I tested my mic my friends couldn’t hear me and I couldn’t hear my friends that well either it works for watching things on my laptop pretty well although they do that annoying thing where if you turn them up too loud everyone in the room can probably hear what you’re watching I don’t mind it too much since I don’t really go to school physically that often anyways I will say that for noise cancellation you can’t hear a thing around you when their at full volume so good for ignoring people you don’t like they are very comfortable to wear for long periods of time at least in my opinion overall I give them 4 out of 5 stars they could use a little improvement

I’d absolutely say user error EXCEPT the kid that it happened to is my careful kid. Anyway, the other two are holding up so far.

The last 2 pairs of headphones I had, had plastic bands and I wasn't doing anything rough with them, I was just opening them to put them on and the plastic broke. This one has a metal band which is a little tight, but I'm sure they'll loosen over time... and I think I'll have these for a few years to come.

I have a slightly larger head than most and when wearing them with my glasses on it was somewhat uncomfortable to wear them, especially long-term. So if you have an above average headsize you may want to look for something different. These would make great gifts for kids or those with smaller heads, especially at such a great price!

The cord was long enough, and the headphones seem reasonably well constructed. The audio quality was fine for what I needed, but I also didn't really test them with music.I like that my ears can fit pretty much entirely within the cups, without the padded parts pressing on them them, but the padded parts are soft enough that it probably wouldn't be a big deal if they did. However, I find they're a little bit tight on my head so they're uncomfortable to wear with my glasses. I also am not a fan of where they press on the joint of my jaw. It's not painful, just unpleasant.Since I need to wear the headphones for long period of time, I need to be really comfortable, so I'm planning on returning it because I don't need another big pair of headphones hanging around. UPDATE: On 2/26/2024 these headphones broke on the actual headband area, right above the hinge where the ear covers can fold inward. I dont think is a defect, as these are meant for kids and I am obviously not one, but I aslo have been fairly rough with these and throwing them in my bag for a year to get jumbled around. Still love them, planning on just gluing it back since they still work.I needed new headset for work as my work-issued JABRAs are old and finally broke. I wanted the following things:-headset NOT earbuds (earbud never stay in)-wired so I dont have to worry about charging or taking up a valuable USB port-non-bluetooth so i dont have to worry about issues connecting-no installation software. I have a company issued laptop, so i can't install anything.- good enough sound. I'm using these for work so calls and listening to things on a laptop. don't need anything super noise cancelling, bass, surround sound or anything.I figured i'd take a chance but had low expectations as these were pretty cheap. I LOVE them. They are colorful which is just a bonus but these fit comfortable over my ears, which is great because I have small ears and often my ears feel smashed wearing headsets. The sound is great. The wire is fabric-threaded and not stiff, long enough so its easy to move around and not knock things over and im not worried about it fraying all over the place. All in all, a GREAT purchase for the price point.

reviews.review_header: Good sound at an attractive price
reviews.review_text: I often use these when practicing on my Yamaha clp-745 digital piano.  Sound through the headphones is actually better than through the piano's speakers (which is typical with headphones....I'm told).  Makes playing the piano sound like an acoustic 9' grand piano. It does lack some in the upper two octaves but delivers very good bass sound. Mid-range notes sound good but are not as crisp as you might want but still sound amazing. And the most amazing thing is I have purchased 4 or5 five other headphones off Amazon which were priced at twice what this one cost.  I had to send most of them back because they were so bad. I used to always refer to Amazon reviews when selecting an item, but lately I am thinking they may be made up. So...main thought is that these inexpensive headphones sound great for what they cost and I recommend you give them a try. I am an adult and they fit and feel good on my head.

reviews.review_header: Wow...! Lots of bang for your buck!
reviews.review_text: I purchased these because my kids broke my only pair of JVC headphones. I was looking for something inexpensive but good just to get me by. I was hoping for just a decent pair of headphones. So after I did a little research, I came across these headphones and it seemed like they had some really good reviews so I pulled-the-trigger on these hoping for the best. WOW.....!! I have to say, these headphones are arguably the best pair of headphones I have ever owned. They are so comfortable and well made. In fact, I let my wife use them for a few hours and now she wants a pair of these for XMAS. Also, I took a phone call using these are they were awesome. No one had any issues with hearing me or me hearing them. Here are a few bullet points that I think are relevant.Sound quality: EXCELLENTComfort: EXCELLENTStyle: EXCELLENTPrice: EXCELLENT (you won't get a better pair for the price)Overall quality: EXCELLENTThey also come in some cool color combos. Would I buy these again for myself or someone else? The answer is 1000% YES.

reviews.review_header: Good basic headphones that don't hurt my ears
reviews.review_text: I got these for work. I have a headset provided by my employer, but it puts pressure on my ears and hurts after an hour or so. And, my employer doesn't allow connecting bluetooth devices to their computers. These are great for listening to my "focus music" while I work. I still know if people are talking, but their words don't get through so it's less distracting. The only drawback is that the cord is a little short, so I have to take the headphones off just to scoot around my cubicle. But they're comfortable and sound fine, especially for under $20!

These are probably some of the best headphones I've ever purchased. My 6 year old, almost 7 is going into 2nd grade in September and needed new headphones as they do a lot on the computers. Well her and I both tried them on and they fit both of us, comfortably. They are truly noise canceling and super comfortable. The colors are super nice as well.
My sons needed headphones for school. We've used this brand for two years and have never had issues. Highly recommend!

One several months ago, and one this week.  So I'm wondering if that second break is the cause of the mic issues.Pros:-good sound quality-blocks out a good amount of surrounding noise for me (via some good cushiony headphones)-blocks out a good amount of surrounding noise for those listening to me on calls (via some kind of noise control in the mic)-comfortable, no more headachesCons:-relatively short shelf life

reviews.review_header: The mic is very low quality. If you need this meetings DO NOT BUY. Otherwise, good sound.
reviews.review_text: I bought this to replace my other headphones for meetings. But given how quickly those died, I wanted something cheaper. I saw these and loved the color and the reviews seemed to rate it highly so I went for them. When I first used them for a meeting no one could hear me. Granted I should have sound checked first. For even remotely good sound, you have to put the mic that's lockated on the control with the volume switch close to your mouth. Even than it sounds muffled and even if it was fine...other headphones at this price point of clear sound and my hands can remain free.The sound is fantastic especially for the price. But if you need the mic...I would walk away from this headset.

I bought these headphones to use with my computer. They are high quality, and I would otherwise give them 4-5 stars, but my goodness, the button on the cord makes these headphones annoying. Any accidental pinch or jerk of the cord, and it will pause YouTube videos, or play a YouTube video in the background that I paused earlier, sometimes it activates Siri or opens up Apple Music.

reviews.review_header: Decent for price, but not high-quality

The second pair only lasted 5 months before cracking. I suppose for the cost it should be expected, but it's a bummer to have to throw away a big piece of equipment that only doesn't work bc of poor production. Alas.

reviews.review_header: Equates the quality to its price.
reviews.review_text: It's not bad for $20.00 but if this product was more, I would not be happy with them. The initial physical quality is actually pretty good. They feel and look very sturdy. The sound quality is what suffers. It's far better than a set of skull candy earbuds; however, the sound is like that of listening to music with a can or a plastic cup on your ear. I get used to it halfway through a song, but it's not a timbre I admire in a pair of headphones. Noise cancelation is a lie. These do not have any such technology. The only escape from ambient noise comes from the padding. It's noise muffling, not noise canceling. With that said, the padding doesn't do too bad of a job. I at first thought I was listening with noise canceling tech. For music, I would not recommend these. For simple gaming or in any other application where the sound quality is not a priority or you just want a cheap set of head phones without going with buds, I'd say save money and buy these.

The downsides are: the folding feature broke (a piece cracked so I have to pop it in place constantly), since that cracked, the headphones sound is kinda glitchy (you know that that glitchy sound in headphones when its bouncing back and forth from one ear to another? yea that) it sounds like the headphones finally broke I guess. reviews.review_header: Not sure if this is meant for PCs.
reviews.review_text: I bought these for use with a "real" PC, not a laptop or some other device. For some reason, the sound quality is bizarrely muffled and garbage...unless the button on the cord is actively being pressed down, which makes it perfectly fine. A cursory search didn't find anyone else having this issue, so I'm not sure if I'm just unlucky or if these are meant for more "modern" computers or what. I resolved the issue myself by tightly strapping the button down with tape...but I shouldn't have to do that with a set of brand-new headphones.Other than that admittedly-serious flaw, the hardware's pretty good for the price. Noise cancellation is great, it's decently comfortable, and it feels pretty robust. I'm not going to bother trying to get mine refunded or replaced, but I have to say that I'm not going to be buying these again in the future.

Not sure if it's only the pink color, but I triple checked and nowhere does it say these are child size. These headphones squeeze really hard under both ears. They fit tightly all around and keep out sound, but don't use noise cancelling technology. These fit my 5 year old perfectly on the smallest setting and fit all around her head. I have an oval head, not square or large so I'm confused why these hurt so bad to wear. I am giving these to my 5 year old and I will have to find a new pair.The sound quality is great, for the price. For music, everything is in balance, but the sound isn't as full and robust as it could be. It's not muffled and the bass is good. The sound is nice and loud, and I didn't have to turn the volume up much at all.

So if you just want cheap headphones for a year, for $14 then these work. They sound is what you would expect for the price but not bad. They should reinforce the connection to the headset and it would last for much longer. Too bad, now Im having to buy another set. reviews.review_header: You get what you pay for!
reviews.review_text: Another lesson learned, when it comes to electronics you get what you pay for. The RORSOU R10 headphones are compact, but that is where the un-asterisked positives end. My pair arrived half broken; the right side non-functional out of the box with no obvious fix. The sound out of the left side is of moderate quality, so I imagine that a functional pair would sound about the same. The headphones feel sturdy and are fairly comfortable for short-term wear, but the padding material on the headband will pull at your hair. They don't look professional either, so they are best for casual use, maybe with a hat or hood between your head and the headband... Final verdict: If you can afford these headphones, you can probably afford to swing for a $50 pair and spare yourself some headache (literally.) If you're on a tight budget, you would be better served with a cheaper, plain black pair -- it will still get the job done -- and you won't feel so bad if they're half-broken on arrival!
The audio quality is horrible and they are painful to wear. If you want a cheap pair of headphones go right ahead but pls find a different pair

It came in and I of course checked it, but the right side doesn't even have sound. The sound quality is okay, It's not the best. but that might be because one side doesn't work. I wouldn't recommend buying this item.
I originally loved the headphones but they broke pretty easily with minimal use. It’s only been 4 months and we are having to replace them.

Bought two pair of these. The sound is great but the framework on both broke withing 5 months. Now I have tape holding them together. Not the quality I was expecting.

Went to use today and when I went to place on my head the right hinge was broken?!? I have an average size head and this was my second use?!? Disappointed as the sound is good however not worth the price if they only last a month!

reviews.review_header: After about 2 months: I could hear crystal clear, but others couldn't hear me.
reviews.review_text: I loved these until they stopped working. I could still hear through them, but they no longer picked up sound. It was frustrating as they went in and out like they had a short. People could hear me, but then they couldn't and then they could - all on the same meeting and there wasn't a set way to move the cord to make it work.Gave them to my daughter and she still uses them to listen to audio books, but they don't work for communication. Only worked to pick up sound a couple to maybe 3 months.

reviews.review_header: believe the one star reviews. Take a risk tho.
reviews.review_text: These are pretty nice headphones for the price. But the first ones I ordered came with a jacked up cable.They sound great, really bassy. Even when they are off they cancel out a lot of noise. I ordered these for my 2nd grader for school and he’s in love with them, the color and the sound.***One thing I would recommend to this company is to make the cable replaceable or interchangeable. ****
El equipo no esta mal para el precio. Lo malo es que queda muy apretado como para la cabeza de un menor. Lo he regalado y pienso buscar otro

I got suckered in by the sale price. Bass is overloaded and the midrange is muddy. Makes vocals sound muted or tinny. Plus, uncomfortable to wear for over an hour as a piece of hard plastic is pressed right up against your earlobe.

Not sure if it's only the pink color, but I triple checked and nowhere does it say these are child size. These headphones squeeze really hard under both ears. They fit tightly all around and keep out sound, but don't use noise cancelling technology. These fit my 5 year old perfectly on the smallest setting and fit all around her head. I have an oval head, not square or large so I'm confused why these hurt so bad to wear. I am giving these to my 5 year old and I will have to find a new pair.The sound quality is great, for the price. For music, everything is in balance, but the sound isn't as full and robust as it could be. It's not muffled and the bass is good. The sound is nice and loud, and I didn't have to turn the volume up much at all.
Bought for eaudiobook reading. These headphones were very uncomfortable after several minutes.
Too tight for an adult to wear

reviews.review_header: just uncomfortably tight and heavy, I broke them trying to loosen them. Money thrown away
reviews.review_text: you heard it here first, there are trash

reviews.review_header: They're comfortable, but only one side works

I'm still using them because the sound on the left side is pretty good, but I wear them with the left side on my right ear because my hearing is better on that side. I didn't return them because I am lazy. The end, an awful story about mediocre headphones, by me.
These didn’t even last two months of school.
The wife liked them but after breaking 3 pair in the same place not more
The problem is that my kid say that in school it doesn’t work

Bought these headphones for son to use in class however after 3 days the sound quit working.  We tried everything to get them work but just ended up tossing them.  Very expensive in my opinion for a poor quality item.

Didn't last long.
This is my second pair in seven months. Not durable, they break save your money by another pair.

The PATHETIC button barely works. would not recommend.

About a month after purchase the sound on the headphones started sounded like a whispering sound and would have to move the wires to get the the sound to come out correctly. Now on month 3 they have completely gone out with no sound. Save your money and buy higher quality that will last longer.

Maybe this is just a general feature of over-ear headphones, but I just realized that the new-onset headaches, unlike any I've ever experienced and onset just in the past 1-2 weeks, are probably due to wearing these headphones.  The sound is fine, seal around the ears is fine, but their clamping pressure is so tight that they have apparently caused headaches.  No way to adjust the horizontal width of the headphones .... maybe I'll try to stretch them manually?  I'll update the review if this works.  If not, please heed my warning!
RORSOU R10 On-Ear Headphones lasted just past the return window.  The item was NOT mistreated.  I would not recommend.
I returned these right away. They were way to big for my head and way too heavy!!!

You have to hold the side volume control on cord the entire time to use. I may and just received a faulty pair but I’m out of the return window time frame so if you purchase try to get some life out of them before putting away for a time to make sure they work!!

These were great from February to September. Then the sound suddenly became garbled. They were taken care of. Now it's too late to return them. Yeah, they may be cheap, but you may have to purchase them twice a year. So, if you're on a budget and need something now that you may have to replace just a few months down the road, then these might be right up your alley. I'm going to look elsewhere. I'm tired of buying replacement headphones all of the time. Maybe I'll get lucky and find a pair that will last 2 or 3 years.
Sound was good but too tight and doesn't have anyway of adjusting.

I thought they would be great they looked compact and comfy but even after less then 10 minutes of wearing them, I had to take them off because of how uncomfortable they were. reviews.review_header: Orderned November, fell apart by June

I'm going to get headphones for twice the cost, to hopefully last twice as long.
the sound was meh. the headphones broke after dropping them once. no bass

THEY WAY TO AROUND EARS.  ZERO BROUSURE

reviews.review_header: You get what you pay for!
reviews.review_text: Another lesson learned, when it comes to electronics you get what you pay for. The RORSOU R10 headphones are compact, but that is where the un-asterisked positives end. My pair arrived half broken; the right side non-functional out of the box with no obvious fix. The sound out of the left side is of moderate quality, so I imagine that a functional pair would sound about the same. The headphones feel sturdy and are fairly comfortable for short-term wear, but the padding material on the headband will pull at your hair. They don't look professional either, so they are best for casual use, maybe with a hat or hood between your head and the headband... Final verdict: If you can afford these headphones, you can probably afford to swing for a $50 pair and spare yourself some headache (literally.) If you're on a tight budget, you would be better served with a cheaper, plain black pair -- it will still get the job done -- and you won't feel so bad if they're half-broken on arrival!
The audio quality is horrible and they are painful to wear. If you want a cheap pair of headphones go right ahead but pls find a different pair

It came in and I of course checked it, but the right side doesn't even have sound. The sound quality is okay, It's not the best. but that might be because one side doesn't work. I wouldn't recommend buying this item.

These worked great at first. Now, when they're folded up, a piece of plastic by where they file pops out on either side. Once that started happening, the microphone isn't working well. It's muffled and the operation on the other end can hardly hear you. Thoroughly disappointed.
Están buenos pero no por mucho tiempo porque te hace dolor los oídos..

The design is sleek and lightweight, which makes them comfortable to wear for extended periods. The battery life is impressive, lasting for several hours on a single charge. Overall, I would recommend these headphones if you are looking for an affordable option that delivers satisfactory performance.

The cord was long enough, and the headphones seem reasonably well constructed. The audio quality was fine for what I needed, but I also didn't really test them with music.I like that my ears can fit pretty much entirely within the cups, without the padded parts pressing on them them, but the padded parts are soft enough that it probably wouldn't be a big deal if they did. However, I find they're a little bit tight on my head so they're uncomfortable to wear with my glasses. I also am not a fan of where they press on the joint of my jaw. It's not painful, just unpleasant.Since I need to wear the headphones for long period of time, I need to be really comfortable, so I'm planning on returning it because I don't need another big pair of headphones hanging around. (I already have a pair for home use, but the cable isn't long enough to reach my work computer.)
does not stay plug into extension cable without duck tape  SAD FACE

It's a great buy.

ideal for laptop computer. Good sound quality Clear audio.

Excelentes

reviews.review_header: Good for a year then the wire breaks
reviews.review_text: These work for $14 headphones. they did what I needed them to do for a year then the wire connecting to the headphone breaks off. Its just a small cheap wire and when you take off the headphones they close together, so teh other sid from the wire rubs against the wire and breaks it off. So if you just want cheap headphones for a year, for $14 then these work. They sound is what you would expect for the price but not bad. They should reinforce the connection to the headset and it would last for much longer. Too bad, now Im having to buy another set. I wont buy these agian though because there is no way to keep it from breaking so I would end up here again in a year. lol

reviews.review_header: Tight on the head, audio ain't the best either.

reviews.review_header: Good sound at an attractive price
reviews.review_text: I often use these when practicing on my Yamaha clp-745 digital piano.  Sound through the headphones is actually better than through the piano's speakers (which is typical with headphones....I'm told).  Makes playing the piano sound like an acoustic 9' grand piano. It does lack some in the upper two octaves but delivers very good bass sound. Mid-range notes sound good but are not as crisp as you might want but still sound amazing. And the most amazing thing is I have purchased 4 or5 five other headphones off Amazon which were priced at twice what this one cost.  I had to send most of them back because they were so bad. I used to always refer to Amazon reviews when selecting an item, but lately I am thinking they may be made up. So...main thought is that these inexpensive headphones sound great for what they cost and I recommend you give them a try. I am an adult and they fit and feel good on my head.
I like that it comfortable and look just like picture a d I like purple and green color

The headphones look great. I was so excited to get them. Then I discovered that the charging cable was missing. I looked over every square inch of that box and bag and it was nowhere. They forgot to include it.

These worked well but then the adjustable ear piece cracked and kept scratching my child’s face and hair got stuck in them.  These won’t last all school year and they don’t take returns a couple months later.

I found the head phones small and too tight on my ears.
Very small and tight. Should really be listed as for children

I very sparsely used them and I found in the last few months that they do not connect to my laptop anymore occasionally they would randomly work but I honestly do not suggest them if you want to buy something that will last more then 6 months.

I didn't have extraordinary expectations for $12 headphones but these will probably be going into the trash. Consider how music might sound if you stuffed your ears full of cotton. That's what these deliver. All notes are muffled and almost indistinguishable. I compared the same music on these with another set of over-the-ear headphones (Samson 850 which I've had over 10 years) and the difference was considerable. On the positive side, the construction looks acceptable. Still going in the trash.

I don't know if there is any warranty at all, but it would be great to somehow get them repaired or replaced.

Didn't expect much for these cheap headphones and even at that it just wasn't worth it. You're better off buying some skullcandy ear buds.There are good things about these headphones but the most important thing here is sound quality, and these just don't have that.
Didn’t last a month.
We bought these for my son for school. They broke in a mater of a month and a half. They are used for class room work, nothing aggressive.

Very hard physically on the ears, and the sound quality is what you pay for. Also, even when the volume is low, the sound projects outside the back side of the headphones so the people around you can hear your music.Save your money and buy another brand.

reviews.review_header: JUNK STAY AWAY AND DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!
reviews.review_text: Horrible sounds issues with this device and very poor overall sound quality. Anything with a beat you hear extra noise. Save your money and stay far away from this product. It is junk and it is a disaster.

reviews.review_header: I would give zero stars if possible
reviews.review_text: These are easily the most uncomfortable headphones I have ever worn upon my head. Now I know how Jesus felt when they put the crown of thorns on his head. I literally have a welt on my ear. As far as sound quality go, its straight mediocre. These headphones are like a bad joke (presumable written by Amy Schumer).
The headphones are junk. The wire in the headphones are cheap. I bought these for my child in Sept and they stop working in Nov.

my son didnt attempt to use the mic until a month after I purchased it.  Naturally it doesnt work.  JUNK

Breaks easy

reviews.review_header: Headband has design flaws and falls apart

It ok

the headset was too tight and broke after a couple of months.

reviews.review_header: Nice for a week, then volume would auto increase to max.
reviews.review_text: This was for my kid.  Noticed she was listening to ipad really loudly.  She says it wouldn't go down.  I checked it out and it auto increased to max volume on other devices.  She was using it this way for a few days.  Hopefully her hearing isn't damaged!  I returned the item.

Use these for computer headphones and enjoyed the sound. I don't have a big head, the top strap/band broke just putting them on today. reviews.review_header: believe the one star reviews. Take a risk tho.

reviews.review_header: Tight on the head, audio ain't the best either.
reviews.review_text: Bought it cause my last pair took a swan dive. These aren't the hottest though. The audio quality feels close but it feels not on point. There isn't any volume knob either. You want my honest advice? Spend a bit more buy some high quality stuff and treat it with love.

Yes, you're right. You get what you pay for and these are terrible. I would not recommend these to anyone. There's a bass note and some highs, but the mid range is awful. Take it from an retired remixer and audiophile that works a very, VERY high-end system on weekends.
Mejor comprar unos de mejor calidad...

reviews.review_header: Ear Hurts after wearing for like 20 mins
reviews.review_text: When I wore them for the first day I thought my ear was just adjusting to the headphones, but I've used it for 20 days now and the pain persists, though these are decent for the price, that's about it, nothing great about them, probably goto an electronics store try getting good headphones that are comfortable for your ear.Going to return these after 20 days of use.

For even remotely good sound, you have to put the mic that's lockated on the control with the volume switch close to your mouth. Even than it sounds muffled and even if it was fine...other headphones at this price point of clear sound and my hands can remain free.The sound is fantastic especially for the price. To sum it up, the old adage "you get what you pay for" certainly applies.

The headphones are too tight on your ears, which leads to them hurting. Other people can barely hear what you say through the mic and the mic sound quality is terrible. Overall, the headphones were okay but they didn't function as a headset. I ended up having to return them.

For $12.86 including tax, I don't think these headphones can be beat. The sound reproduction of music is obviously limited in range, but if you just want to hear some music on your laptop or desktop computer it's probably the best you can find for under about $50.

Not a bad price, but I wish I had paid a little more for a better set of headphones.

I got them for my son for school.  He likes the look and comfort and is happy with them.  I tried them and they are comfortable, but sound quality is less than I expected.
The headphone's vocal sounds lacked treble. It was difficult to understand speech.

reviews.review_header: Was nice while it lasted but it only lasted 2 months

FIT TOO TIGHT. HURT MY EARS. SHOULD BE ADJUSTABLE TO RELIEVE PRESSURE ON EARS. DISTRACTS FROM MOVIE ENJOYMENT.

reviews.review_header: Great headset at first, but broke after a month of daily use
reviews.review_text: this is the third round of headphones I've had to buy for my kids.  The sound quality is great and the kids like being able to differentiate their headphones by color, but after around a month of daily use, the sound starts to crackle, and consistently stops working on one side. These would be good if you don't need to use your headphones daily.  Not for heavy use.
