reviews.review_header: Super cute but a bit off on me
reviews.review_text: Great construction and sound. Super cute on top of that. Unfortunately these were a bit too tight and sat too low for me - they cause intense jaw pain and the noise cancelling triggered my migraines.If those aren't problems for you, then definitely get these!

reviews.review_header: Equates the quality to its price.
reviews.review_text: It's not bad for $20.00 but if this product was more, I would not be happy with them. The initial physical quality is actually pretty good. They feel and look very sturdy. The sound quality is what suffers. It's far better than a set of skull candy earbuds; however, the sound is like that of listening to music with a can or a plastic cup on your ear. I get used to it halfway through a song, but it's not a timbre I admire in a pair of headphones. Noise cancelation is a lie. These do not have any such technology. The only escape from ambient noise comes from the padding. It's noise muffling, not noise canceling. With that said, the padding doesn't do too bad of a job. I at first thought I was listening with noise canceling tech. For music, I would not recommend these. For simple gaming or in any other application where the sound quality is not a priority or you just want a cheap set of head phones without going with buds, I'd say save money and buy these.

Are very snug on the head. I wear glasses, and by the end of a couple hours, my ears and my head right under the earpiece hurt because they're just too snug. I have small ears. If they made the ear pieces just a bit larger, these would be perfect.
Its ok but ther are no volume control and sound was too loud
Too uncomfortable to be able to relax
The headphones work well, but my child was disappointed since we received pink and we ordered blue.

These headphones are great for the price, especially their sound quality. Unfortunately, the midsection will break, or one of the hinges will fail very easily. I have bought multiple pairs before realizing that they are far too delicate to travel with me for school.Would only recommend if you need to save money and plan to keep them at a stationary device such as a desktop.

I run a woodshop and hearing protection is important. Routers, saws, planers all make an incredible amount of noise and these do not block out as much of the sound as I would like. The sound and the Bluetooth work well. These will work well for listening to your computer or tv, just not well suited for the workshop.

reviews.review_header: Great Sound, Unfortunately Not Very Sturdy
reviews.review_text: So the individual features they ask you to rate all apply to sound, as as far as sound goes these are great for the price.  However, the part that locks the headphones in place when you move them from folded to ready to wear broke early on in the life of my pair.  This wasn't super bothersome, as you only really keep them unfolded if you're going to wear them, and they aren't spring loaded or anything crazy to where they try and close while you're wearing them.  Folding and unfolding is strictly a manual event, and as a 45 year old man I know the value of NOT trying to do something odd like hold one earpiece and fling them open.  I always GENTLY opened them and put them on.  The other week, as I removed them, I *did* hold them by one side and reached out to put them down.  The unit broke where the hard plastic meets the soft bit that cushions your head.  They don't fold there naturally.  I've NEVER flung them down in anger or otherwise done anything other than take them off and set them down in a calm fashion.TL;DR - Good sound, super fragile.  Treat them like they're made of glass.

I've had these for 15 months.They've been great until today when all the sudden people on my calls say that I'm breaking up.The joints of the headphones have both broken.  One several months ago, and one this week.  So I'm wondering if that second break is the cause of the mic issues.Pros:-good sound quality-blocks out a good amount of surrounding noise for me (via some good cushiony headphones)-blocks out a good amount of surrounding noise for those listening to me on calls (via some kind of noise control in the mic)-comfortable, no more headachesCons:-relatively short shelf life

The sound is OK, but not great, rather flat.The worst part is they are too small.  It hurt to wear them more for a few minutes.I gave them to my grandson.You are better off spending more on a higher quality set.
Good, but not for long term. Breaks every 6 to 8 months.
They make your head feel like it is in a vice. They are very tight!

Headphones Sound good, but They are too HEAVY for me, but I plan to keep them. I just can't Wear them very long at a Time because they are Heavy and I'm use to Light weight Headphones that I can wear all Day.

these headphones are quite good but if you got a big head you should be careful I've had my pair for like 6 months and its starting to crack at the top of it because it can't really fit my head to well. but if you got small head these are great.

This is my second attempt to replace an excellent headphone that I broke and is no longer available on Amazon.  This item doesn't measure up. Not particularly enjoying the inconsistency of sound so I rarely use it which is unfortunate.

reviews.review_header: Very uncomfortable and no volume control, but decent sound quality.
reviews.review_text: These are competitively priced and for the price, the sound quality is decent.  The bass is a bit weak, but the midrange and treble are crisp and clear.  The main problem is that these are very tight on the ear and cannot be worn for more than 45 minutes without causing pain.  These work better for kids because they are not as tight on children under 10 Y, and we got these for our grandson.  He is OK with them, although they do bother him if he wears them more than an hour.

reviews.review_header: Good headphones but breaks very fast
reviews.review_text: This product is really good and cute but it breaks really quickly.

Because the ear muff dissent cover my ears, the other noise around me is audible and none of the features are effective.  I think the entire headset is too small.  There was no info on size with the details on Amazon.  I've owned better.

reviews.review_header: Not as comfortable as you might think
reviews.review_text: This is a case of you get what you pay for. I was on a very limited budget and trying to get a headset so I could listen to music at work as well as use for virtual meetings, as my previous headset was falling apart.Looking at reviews on this item I saw multiple people saying it was more comfortable than expected and I think they might have been referring to kids.I am a 27-year old man and these are not very comfortable. The fake leather isn't very soft and your ears will start to hurt after an hour of wearing these. I work 8 hours a day so that's pretty frustrating. I am considering returning these and looking for something else that I can wear for longer than that.
Ex loves these. Took a while to ship and arrived after we broke up though

They look and feel nice but the sound is kind of subpar. Not terrible for the price but I think it's worth spending a bit more for better sound. They're not too terribly made but they do also feel like they won't last very long.

I bought these a year ago. Very snug. Stretched little by little using the corner width of a Kleenex box.PRO: Cuts outside noise by Half or more. Good quality sound.Con: Over-bending of headband may cause breakage.Somehow the outer headband became cracked. After prolonged daily use, the crack caused an indention which made the headband push inward. I tried to make an adjustment, and the headband broke. I will try these one more time. If the same thing happens - I will look elsewhere.
Works good for kids iPad

I do a lot of transcription at work and wanted a new pair of headphones, but needed a moderately long cable to reach the plug into my work computer. The cord was long enough, and the headphones seem reasonably well constructed. The audio quality was fine for what I needed, but I also didn't really test them with music.I like that my ears can fit pretty much entirely within the cups, without the padded parts pressing on them them, but the padded parts are soft enough that it probably wouldn't be a big deal if they did. However, I find they're a little bit tight on my head so they're uncomfortable to wear with my glasses. I also am not a fan of where they press on the joint of my jaw. It's not painful, just unpleasant.Since I need to wear the headphones for long period of time, I need to be really comfortable, so I'm planning on returning it because I don't need another big pair of headphones hanging around. (I already have a pair for home use, but the cable isn't long enough to reach my work computer.)
for the price they are worth it. sound is decent.

reviews.review_header: Decent headset but not the best build quality.
reviews.review_text: The joint on the right side cracked weirdly and now it doesn't fold in properly or stay out without some fussing with it.The sound quality's fine, and it still works good.  The most important part is that it's reasonably comfortable.  That's a big issue with some of the cheaper headsets like this one, but this one is good on that front.For it's below 20$ price?  It's a great buy.

First off don't expect high-end quality for the price, however, these are better than expected! I got them for my Dad when he watches TV at night. They're soft and comfortable, no pinching. The sound quality is decent for the price. He LOVES them! He says they're one of his favorites! If you're looking for something for this type of purpose it's a no-brainer!

UPDATE: On 2/26/2024 these headphones broke on the actual headband area, right above the hinge where the ear covers can fold inward. I dont think is a defect, as these are meant for kids and I am obviously not one, but I aslo have been fairly rough with these and throwing them in my bag for a year to get jumbled around. Still love them, planning on just gluing it back since they still work.I needed new headset for work as my work-issued JABRAs are old and finally broke. I wanted the following things:-headset NOT earbuds (earbud never stay in)-wired so I dont have to worry about charging or taking up a valuable USB port-non-bluetooth so i dont have to worry about issues connecting-no installation software. I have a company issued laptop, so i can't install anything.- good enough sound. I'm using these for work so calls and listening to things on a laptop. don't need anything super noise cancelling, bass, surround sound or anything.I figured i'd take a chance but had low expectations as these were pretty cheap. I LOVE them. They are colorful which is just a bonus but these fit comfortable over my ears, which is great because I have small ears and often my ears feel smashed wearing headsets. The sound is great. The wire is fabric-threaded and not stiff, long enough so its easy to move around and not knock things over and im not worried about it fraying all over the place. All in all, a GREAT purchase for the price point.
Didn't expect anything amazing and didn't get it.

The noise blockage is nice, and the sound quality is nicely clear and reliable. The only struggle is volume control, as it's set for the most part which is oddly loud but nod a bad trade off for the quality and clarity. Worth it easily, and will hopefully last long.

Amazing headphones. Doesn't use the standard wire that's easy to tear and wear like most headphones have.Update 12/23/23: Now down to 3 - 4 stars because the part that plugs into the device (with the little circular rings) bent after i dropped my ipad by accident and can lo longer plug into my devices all the way. Had to buy a whole new set of headphones..

These were purchased for my 5 year old son as an alternative to expensive noise cancelling headphones.  They are easy to pair and work great when using his iPad on plane trips and long car rides.  They are quality headphones at a reasonable price.

reviews.review_header: These are really some great headphones for the price; but no privacy.
reviews.review_text: No.  They are not the anything and everything.  I kind of wish I spent some more to get some wireless earbuds.  But you are not going to go wrong with this headset.  It has great sound quality.  They do a great job sealing sound out, so you think all is quiet.  But the headset leaks a lot of noise.  I love listening to music, but I have found that I am being too loud.  These headphones kill all the outside noise and drop into a place of no distractions.  I love the sound quality of these headphones.  While you may think that you are in a quiet space alone with these headphones, you are going to have to think about those around you.  They are going to hear everything that you hear.  Be aware and be wise.  Sound quality is great, privacy quality sucks.  Everything that you hear, everyone around you hears the same.  No privacy if that is what you seek.

reviews.review_header: Great product (with one minor exception) - needed wired headsets

Great value - love them.Follow-up note - I am a repeat buyer and two of the first ones I bought had an issue where the headset folding clip broke (see pic).  I use the headsets daily, a few times a day for meetings (on and off my head).  They still function well but the flopping of the earpiece when putting on and taking off is annoying, so I have bought more to replace these.  For $21 each  I am not really upset.  I just thought this should be mentioned.  I took one star away due to this.  Functionally they should be a five star product for the low cost, even with replacing once or twice a year.

reviews.review_text: I bought each of my kids a pair of these headphones to use with their movie players and iPads. They love how comfortable they are and the great colors. Unfortunately one of the posts that plug into the headphone port broke off inside the jack. I was able to remove it as there was a bit sticking out. I’d absolutely say user error EXCEPT the kid that it happened to is my careful kid. Anyway, the other two are holding up so far.

The price is definitely reasonable... I don't need a fancy pair of headphones so these will do. The last 2 pairs of headphones I had, had plastic bands and I wasn't doing anything rough with them, I was just opening them to put them on and the plastic broke. This one has a metal band which is a little tight, but I'm sure they'll loosen over time... and I think I'll have these for a few years to come.

I have a slightly larger head than most and when wearing them with my glasses on it was somewhat uncomfortable to wear them, especially long-term. So if you have an above average headsize you may want to look for something different. These would make great gifts for kids or those with smaller heads, especially at such a great price!
